issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Have no idea if this is bfebs image related, but that seemed to be the difference in this test attempt...

I attempted to upgrade to 3.1 and it failed. Prior to upgrade I did the following:
-Created an account - matt
-Created a user within that acount - mattuser
-Created a group within that account mattgroup (authorized icmp, udp, tcp)
-Created a bfebs image (so there'll be  the snap and volume from that image creation) I attempted to do the creation under the matt user.
(there's a chance I left an instance up on accident while creating the bfebs image).
Upgraded....


http://qa-server/euca-qa/display_test.php?testname=matt-big-test-00&uid=1034


{code}

ssh command returned error on 192.168.51.74
done with service start on system

{code}
fields.summary: Upgrade does not handle BFEBS image type

comments.body: Confirmed, EBS images are handled by a different class than other EMIs, and the upgrade script was not handling this case.

should be fixed now.  it would be good to retest on a system with various device mapping type entries (bfebs image, ephemeral mappings, and "suppress" mappings ), to ensure that all are handled properly.
Retested. Was able to launch a bfebs image registered prior to upgrade
